revision.text:
{{wiktionary|pig}}
A '''[[pig]]''' is a mammal of the genus ''Sus''.
'''Pig''', '''PIG''', or '''PIGS''' may also refer to: {{tocright}} ==Animals== *[[Domestic pig]], ''Sus scrofa domestica'' or ''Sus domestica'' **[[Wild Pig]], or Eurasian Wild Boar, ''Sus scrofa'', the species from which the domestic pig was bred ***''[[Pig|Sus]]'', a genus within the pig family, including ''Sus scrofa'' and closely related southeast Asian species ****[[Suinae]], the pig subfamily, including ''Sus'' and other genera from Africa and southeast Asia *****[[Suidae]], the pig family, including Suinae and other extinct Old World subfamilies ******[[Suina]], a suborder of mammals including Suidae, and the Tayssuidae (peccaries or "New World pigs")
*[[Hell pig]]s or terminator pigs, the Entelodonts, a family of extinct mammals *[[Pork]], the meat of a domestic pig *[[Feral pig]], domestic pig living in the wild *[[Guinea pig]], a domestic species of rodent that is popular as a pet
==Film== *''[[Daddy's Deadly Darling]]'' or ''Pigs'', a 1972 horror film *[[Pigs (1992 film)|''Pigs'' (1992 film)]] or ''Psy'', a film by Wladyslaw Pasikowski *[[Pig (1998 film)|''Pig'' (1998 film)]], a 1998 film written by and starring Rozz Williams *[[Pigs (2007 film)|''Pigs'' (2007 film)]], a film by Karl DiPelino *[[Pig (2010 film)|''Pig'' (2010 film)]], a horror film by Adam Mason *[[Pig (2011 film)|''Pig'' (2011 film)]], a film written by Henry Barrial
==Music== *[[Pigs (b.l.o.w. album)|''Pigs'' (b.l.o.w. album)]], 1996 *[[Pigs (Asphalt Ballet album)|''Pigs'' (Asphalt Ballet album)]], 1993 *[[PIG (musical project)]], musical project by Raymond Watts *[[Pig (song)|"Pig" (song)]], a 1998 song by the Dave Matthews Band *"[[Pigs (Three Different Ones)]]", a 1977 song by Pink Floyd *"Pig", a bonus song from ''[[Weezer (2008 album)|Weezer]]'' Deluxe Edition *"Pigs", a song by Eyehategod from ''[[In the Name of Suffering]]'' *"PIG", an early demo version of "Mr. Jack" by [[System of a Down]] *"Pigs", a track on ''[[Cypress Hill (album)|Cypress Hill]]'', Cypress Hill's first album
==Games== *[[Pig (dice)]], a dice game *Pig, a variation of the card game [[Spoons#Variations|Spoons]] *P-I-G, a variation of the basketball game [[H-O-R-S-E]]
==Science and technology== *[[PIGS (genetics)]], a human gene *[[Humber Pig]], a British military vehicle *Pig (pipeline inspection gauge), used in [[pigging]], a form of pipeline maintenance *[[Pig (programming tool)]], a MapReduce programming tool used on Hadoop *[[Distillation pig]], a piece of glassware that allows fractions to be collected without breaking vacuum *[[Pig iron]], a type of smelted iron ** Pig, another term for [[ingot]] *Lead pig, a container made of [[lead shielding]] for storing and transporting radioactive materials * Pig, a small [[sandbag]] used for flood control inside a building * [[The Pig]], a firefighting tool * Nickname for the [[M60 machine gun]]
==Other uses== *[[Pig, Kentucky]] *[[Pig (short story)|"Pig" (short story)]], by Roald Dahl *[[Pig (zodiac)]], a sign of the Chinese zodiac *[[PIGS (economics)]], acronym for the economies of Portugal, Ireland (originally Italy), Greece, and Spain, used by bond analysts *[[PIG (elections)]], a campaign strategy *[[Partido da Imprensa Golpista]], or PiG, a pejorative term for the mainstream Brazilian media *[[Pine Island Glacier]], or PIG, a glacier of Antarctica *The [[Pisabo language]] in ISO 639-3 code, <tt>pig</tt> *[[List of police-related slang terms#P|Slang for a police officer]]
==See also== *[[Piggy (disambiguation)]] *[[Piglet (disambiguation)]] *[[Swine (disambiguation)]] *[[Hog (disambiguation)]] *[[Boar (disambiguation)]] *[[Cultural references to pigs]] *[[List of fictional pigs]] *[[List of domestic pig breeds]]
{{disambiguation}}
